body:
cc @haon4 @anandolee for questions regarding protoc.exe (please let me know if I should ping someone else on this instead)
cc @shirhatti @JamesNK @jtattermusch FYI

> 1. The formatting of protoc.exe seems strange. When the msvs option is specified, the output looks something like:
>    `../Protos/greet.proto(14) : error in column=10: "name" is already defined in "Greet.HelloRequest".`
>    However, the current format of errors is:
>    `Startup.cs(12,17): error CS1001: Identifier expected`
>    Note that the column number is formatted differently and there's a error code `CS1001` specified. Is there a reason why protoc.exe outputs in a different format for msvs?
AFAICT, both GCC and MSVS option should output the same line and column number: https://github.com/protocolbuffers/protobuf/blob/master/src/google/protobuf/compiler/command_line_interface.cc#L342. The CS1001 seems to be coming from the C# compiler, not from the protoc compiler.

> 2. Warnings do not specify location in the file. For example: `../Protos/greet.proto: warning: Import google/protobuf/empty.proto but not used.` Why is the location information missing? I've defaulted the link to the beginning of the file but I feel this information should be available from protoc.exe and it should be updated.
> 3. Sometimes errors also don't specify location. For example: `../Protos/greet.proto: Import "google/protobuf/empty.proto" was listed twice.` Again, I've defaulted the link to the beginning of the file but I feel this information should be available from protoc.exe and it should be updated.
- Unfortunately, some of the errors happen at final semantic validation time, not at parsing time, and we have lost the source code location there: https://github.com/protocolbuffers/protobuf/blob/master/src/google/protobuf/descriptor.cc#L4161. It will take a good deal of refactoring to propagate that all the way through. We do a pretty bad job at preserving the source code location at semantic validation time currently :(

> 4. Does protoc.exe ever write anything other than errors and warnings to standard output or standard error?
- Not that I am aware of.

> 5. Do errors and warnings ever use a different format than the ones I've listed?
- GCC and MSVS are the only ErrorFormat that we support: https://github.com/protocolbuffers/protobuf/blob/master/src/google/protobuf/compiler/command_line_interface.h#L383

@haon4 
> AFAICT, both GCC and MSVS option should output the same line and column number: https://github.com/protocolbuffers/protobuf/blob/master/src/google/protobuf/compiler/command_line_interface.cc#L342. The CS1001 seems to be coming from the C# compiler, not from the protoc compiler.

Yes the line numbers and columns are correct. What I mean is that format of the output of the protoc seems incorrect (or outdated?). The expected MSVS format is `file:(line:column) error/warning code: message` but protoc is not writing the column in the expected format and does not include a code. Do you know why it was written this way? Unless there's a compelling reason, we should consider updating the output format to protoc.

> GCC and MSVS are the only ErrorFormat that we support: 

What I meant was referring to were these formats:
Error with location:
`../Protos/greet.proto(14) : error in column=10: "name" is already defined in "Greet.HelloRequest".`
Error without location:
`../Protos/greet.proto: Import "google/protobuf/empty.proto" was listed twice.`
Warning without location:
`../Protos/greet.proto: warning: Import google/protobuf/empty.proto but not used.`
Is there any others? Are there warnings with locations and what would be its format?

> @haon4
> 
> > AFAICT, both GCC and MSVS option should output the same line and column number: https://github.com/protocolbuffers/protobuf/blob/master/src/google/protobuf/compiler/command_line_interface.cc#L342. The CS1001 seems to be coming from the C# compiler, not from the protoc compiler.
> 
> Yes the line numbers and columns are correct. What I mean is that format of the output of the protoc seems incorrect (or outdated?). The expected MSVS format is `file:(line:column) error/warning code: message` but protoc is not writing the column in the expected format and does not include a code. Do you know why it was written this way? Unless there's a compelling reason, we should consider updating the output format to protoc.

Hmm. This was introduced back in 2009 by external contribution. It was before we even moved to Github, so the context was basically gone. I am not aware of anyone depending on the current ERROR_FORMAT_MSVS format, so maybe we can just fix it. We don't have the concept of an error/warning code though, but we should be able to output the line and column in the correct format. Would you like to send us a PR for this?

> 
> > GCC and MSVS are the only ErrorFormat that we support:
> 
> What I meant was referring to were these formats:
> Error with location:
> `../Protos/greet.proto(14) : error in column=10: "name" is already defined in "Greet.HelloRequest".`
> Error without location:
> `../Protos/greet.proto: Import "google/protobuf/empty.proto" was listed twice.`
> Warning without location:
> `../Protos/greet.proto: warning: Import google/protobuf/empty.proto but not used.`
> Is there any others? Are there warnings with locations and what would be its format?

The error format is basically controlled by this function: https://github.com/protocolbuffers/protobuf/blob/master/src/google/protobuf/compiler/command_line_interface.cc#L325

> Would you like to send us a PR for this?

I'll file an issue to track this, but I'll proceed with this PR with the current format for now. Since it's a "breaking" change, we might need to think about compatibility between protoc versions and Grpc.Tools versions. Edit: actually the parsing logic is in Grpc.Tools which specifies a version of protoc so I think we're safe there. 

> The error format is basically controlled by this function:

Right, which is why I think there is a format for warnings with locations. However, I couldn't actually find an example of these sorts of warnings in the code base currently so I was wondering if you knew of any. I could add parsing for this format to future-proof against new warnings from protoc if they are ever added. Do you think that's a good idea or should we leave it for now?

> > Would you like to send us a PR for this?
> 
> I'll file an issue to track this, but I'll proceed with this PR with the current format for now. Since it's a "breaking" change, we might need to think about compatibility between protoc versions and Grpc.Tools versions.

SGTM.

> 
> > The error format is basically controlled by this function:
> 
> Right, which is why I think there is a format for warnings with locations. However, I couldn't actually find an example of these sorts of warnings in the code base currently so I was wondering if you knew of any. I could add parsing for this format to future-proof against new warnings from protoc if they are ever added. Do you think that's a good idea or should we leave it for now?

I see that we invoke AddWarning with locations here: https://github.com/protocolbuffers/protobuf/blob/master/src/google/protobuf/compiler/importer.cc#L211, which is invoked from here: https://github.com/protocolbuffers/protobuf/blob/master/src/google/protobuf/descriptor.cc#L3644.

Ah I see, not sure why I missed it before but I can reproduce a warning with location now: `../Protos/greet.proto(19) : warning in column=5 : warning : When enum name is stripped and label is PascalCased (Zero), this value label conflicts with Zero. This will make the proto fail to compile for some languages, such as C#.` Will update implementation and try to add tests.

Ready for review, cc @jtattermusch @haon4 @JamesNK 

I'm not sure what's causing the Sanity Check failures:
```
2019-03-26 09:17:16,073 FAILED: tools/buildgen/generate_projects.sh
2019-03-26 09:17:16,105 FAILED: Some tests failed
```

Also The distribution tests Linux failure looks unrelated:
```
Err http://deb.debian.org jessie-updates/main amd64 Packages
Ign http://ftp.debian.org jessie-backports Release
Err http://deb.debian.org jessie-updates/main amd64 Packages
Err http://deb.debian.org jessie-updates/main amd64 Packages
Err http://ftp.debian.org jessie-backports/main amd64 Packages
Err http://deb.debian.org jessie-updates/main amd64 Packages
Err http://deb.debian.org jessie-updates/main amd64 Packages
  404  Not Found
Err http://ftp.debian.org jessie-backports/main amd64 Packages
Get:4 http://security.debian.org jessie/updates/main amd64 Packages [822 kB]
Get:5 http://deb.debian.org jessie/main amd64 Packages [9098 kB]
Err http://ftp.debian.org jessie-backports/main amd64 Packages
Err http://ftp.debian.org jessie-backports/main amd64 Packages
Err http://ftp.debian.org jessie-backports/main amd64 Packages
  404  Not Found
W: Failed to fetch http://deb.debian.org/debian/dists/jessie-updates/main/binary-amd64/Packages  404  Not Found
W: Failed to fetch http://ftp.debian.org/debian/dists/jessie-backports/main/binary-amd64/Packages  404  Not Found
E: Some index files failed to download. They have been ignored, or old ones used instead.
```
(the sanity check failure seems unrelated, and the problem has been fixed).

The VS UI currently looks like:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2030323/55019943-16192e00-4fb3-11e9-8e1d-9655e0727c5b.png)
It now has all the correct line numbers when errors/warnings produce them.
@JamesNK  any other concerns? If not, I'll merge.
